JEUS Web Manager Main View JEUS Cluster JEUS Node Tree
Home Settings Logout Help
Node Node is an important component of JEUS A node is a logical component encapsulating the JEUS server's subcomponents such as containers and engines. A node and JEUS Manager is closely related to each other and one JEUS Manager manages only one node. So, JEUS Manager can be regarded as a node.
Engine Containers JEUS Engine container includes the infrastructure for JEUS engines and a wide range of subcomponents for providing services. Engine Containers can be regarded logically as subcomponents of a JEUS node but will be located physically on a different JVM. This property is always true unless "default" Engine container is in use.
Engine Container Resources Databases, external data repository (such as EIS) and services can by dynamically added to the JEUS system through JNDI. Resources registered as such can be found and reused by clients through JNDI.
Engine Container Services JEUS system provides many useful services as follows. JNDI server, Transaction, JMX server, Class FTP, Scheduler, Security, and Log.
Deployment A deployment is a series of processes such as compressing the application files and then sending them to the server to enable the applications to run. JEUS provides the Deployment API and the Deploy Manager can deploy any J2EE applications.
version node user start time Help file does not exist.
Show Details Hide
JEUS Web Manager
Login Login
Configuration Display Settings - Display From this display settings, you can configure the JEUS Web Manager display. All the settings are stored in the cookie.
refresh Settings - Refresh Refresh settings configure the refresh cycle of JEUS Web Manager Views. Each refresh cycle is recorded per second. All the settings are stored in the cookie.
XML Settings - XML From this settings screen, you can configure the options for processing XML files. All the settings are stored in the cookie.
Show Description This option is used for choosing whether to show the explanation for each element or form. When this setting is configured to 'true', the explanation will appear and when configured to 'false', the explanation will disappear. Although the explanation is not shown, clicking each element will bring the explanation.
Language This Option is used for choosing language for form element description or help.
JEUS Cluster Refresh Interval Enter the value for the refresh interval of the JEUS Cluster list. Since it takes much time to get the node list in the cluster, it is recommended to extend the interval as the nodes in the cluster increase.
JEUS Node Tree Refresh Interval Enter the JEUS Node Tree Refresh Interval.
'Log Analysis' Status View - Refresh Cycle When you are analyzing the logs using the log analysis tool, this task is displayed in the 'Log Analysis' Status view. If you shorten the refresh interval, the view is refreshed faster according to new interval value and the display is updated faster to show more current analysis.
Limited time on connecting with JEUS Manager Connection will be closed while there has been no response from JEUS Manager within connected time. period.
Limited time period of JEUS Manger Socket Connection will be closed while there has been no response from JEUS Manager within the limited time period after connecting with JEUS Manager.
Maintaining Comments JEUS are using JAXB to process all the XML files. If you configure this setting to 'false', comments may be lost, as JAXB generally doesn't maintain the comments. It is recommended to maintain comments, if possible.
Element Reordering The sequence of element may be scrambled if the configuration file is modified without tools. When processing the XML files, the validity of file is always checked to see whether the element sequence is proper. An error will occur if the element is not properly arranged. If you configure this setting to 'true', then the element is rearranged and this makes the document valid.

Overview Engine Container Name Status Actions Start Down Start All Down All Creating a new Engine Container Cloning Engine Container Cloning of Engine Container is successfully done.\r\nWhen configuring the copied Engine containers and Engines, change the Port number.\r\nPort number to be changed is as follows .\r\n 1) Web Listener Port\r\n 2) JMS Engine Port\r\n 3) JMX Adapter Port etc . Creation of Engine Container is successfully done. Engine Continer should have one or more engines in it. Add Engine immediately. In engine container, more than a single engine should exist. Add Engine. Enter {0} Name of Engine. Configure listener(id, port) while generating servlet engine. {0} is already configured id.\r\nConfigure different ID. {0} port is already configured value.\r\nConfigure other value. Configure Channel name and port when generating JMS engine. {0} port is already configured value.\r\nConfigure different value .

Creation Creation Creating a new Engine Creating a new Engine Cloning Engine Container Name Availability of generating Engine Engines Configure engine included in newly generated engine container. Engine Container configures more than a single engine. When generating sevlet engine, configure id and port of Http listener. When generating JMS engine, configure name and port of server channel. In case where WS engine in other container is configured, "generate" option on table will not appear since one WS engine should exist in a single node. EJB Engine Name Servlet Engine Name Configure servlet engine name to generate . Configure on whether to generate servlet engine. Web Listener ID Configure id of Web listener on servlet engine. Web Listener Port Configure Web listener port of servlet engine. Creation Creating a New Engine Creating a New EJB Engine Creating a New Servlet Engine Creating a New JMS Engine Creating a New Web Server Engine Engine Name Engine Type Use existing configurations Server Channel Name This is the name of Server Channel. It is used for configuring channel information on Connection Factory . Server Channel Port This is the service port number of specified server channel. Listener ID This refers to unique name for specific listener.This name is used for refering specific listener from other pats of configuration file. Listener Port Port used for receiving HTTP request from client. HTTP port will be assigned to 80 according to IANA(www.iana.org). In case of secure listener, this means port is used for accepting HTTPS request.

Permanent Module - Targets At this stage, select the module to be deployed. As all modules are deployed in the Engine Container as a unit, select the Engine container to which modules are deployed.
Targets Available Context Group Virtual Host At least more than one targets must be selected. Java Permission Specification Java Permission Description
Permanent Module - Options For Each Component Options For Each Component Options For EJB Component Keep the generated codes Fast Deploy Applying this settings to the same type of modules? URI Options For WEB Component Context Group Options For Application Client Component Options For Resource Adapter
Permanent Module - Common Options
Permanent Module - Deploy Deploy Apply the changed configurations of selected module. 2 Phase Deploy If the 2 Phase Deployment option is selected, deployment will not be completed unless the given modules are successfully deployed to all the targets. Even when one module fails to be deployed, other modules successfully deployed in advance will be automatically removed.
Permanent Deployment Configuration Permanent Deployment If Permanent Deploy is selected, the module information is registered in the JEUSMain.xml file and JEUS is automatically booted. Note that if this value is selected, runtime deployment is not available. You can check permanently deployed modules from the permanent deployment tree.
There are no booted engine containers. In this case, modules'll be always permanenty deployed. If Permanent Deploy is selected, the module information is registered in the JEUSMain.xml file and JEUS is automatically booted. Note that if this value is selected, runtime deployment is not available. You can check permanently deployed modules from the permanent deployment tree.
Runtime Deployment When modules are permanently deployed, runtime deployment option is selected.

Log Level Control Create New Log Handler 1. Configuration 2. General 3. Create Create New Log Handler Configuration JEUS Log Service - Log Level Control Control Log Level Control Handler Level JEUS Log Service - Create New Handler JEUS Log Service - Handler Type Select handler type for selected logger to use. Create Handler- General Handler Configuration Select values for handler that will create. Create Handler - Create Create Handler. Create New Log Handler You must select handler type to create. Logger Name Handler Type Handler Name Handler Level Encoding Filter Class File Name Valid Duration Buffer Size Append Handler Class Handler Properties Formatter Class Formatter Properties SMTP Server Address From To Cc Bcc Send All Messages IP Address Port Set XML Configure name of handler. At this time, this name should be configured as unique within a single Logger. This name is used for referencing handler in tool. This handler configures encoding to be used in case of leaving message . Configure fully qualified class name of filter class to be configured in this handler. This handler will configure file name to use. If user has not configured this, default file name of each logger will be used. For each default file name, please refer to JEUS Server Manual. File in which this handler is using will be used for configured time period and used after renewal. Configure the size of buffer to be used when displaying file by this handler. Determine whether to add after the file in case where file in which this handler is using already exists. If it is configured as false, existing file will be deleted. Configure fully qualified class name in which user has created. This class should inherit java.util.logging.Handler and implement jeus.util.logging.JeusHandler. Configure property to pass when handler is generated. These properties are stored in Map object as key-value and delivered to handler through JeusHandler.setProperty() method. Configure fully qualified class name of formatter to be used by this handler.This class inherits java.util.logging.Formatter and should implement jeus.util.logging.JeusFormatter. Configure property to be delivered to generated formatter when handler is generated. These properties are delivered to formatter through JEUSFormatter.setProperty() method storing in Map Object as key-value. Configure SMTP server to send email. Configure address of email sender email. Configure the address of email receiver. Configure the address of email reference contact. Configure address of email hidden reference contact. The messages entered into this handler through log() method of registered logger in which this handler has been registered,it configures whether to consider it as object to send email.If it is configured as false, it only transfers message called using send() method of logger. Thus, only messages with intension for sending as email are transferred. Configure IP address to send messages when this handler is generated. Configure port to send message when this handler is generated. Either of generating previously configured handler or configure it in XML file. Configure handler- Default configuration of Handler Modify configuration values of selected handler.
Level Logger Name Apply Recursively Use Parent Handler Control Logger Level Control Handler Level Logger Name Handler Type Handler Name Handler Level
Configuration Virtual Host Configuration - Configuration Registering the Virtual Node. Type in the following format.'${host_name}:${port}${vitual_host}' Whitespace can be embedded as blank or tab. 1. Module Selection 2. Target 3. Options 4. Options 2 5. Deploy 6. Results
New Application Module Deployment - Module Selection At the Module Selection Stage, you should select a module to be deployed. There are three ways to select the module. Firstly, you can select a module from the application home directory. Secondly, enter a module file name located at the given path, or absolute path of a directory. When a directory is entered, it is called as 'EXPLODED mode' and only one container of that directoy can be selected to be deployed to. Lastly, upload the file placed at the localhost to the server.
File Absolute Path Application Home
Module File Upload Absolute Path Application Home Directory Selection
Select the module to be deployed. New Application Module Deployment - Target At this stage, select the module to be deployed. As all modules are deployed in the Engine Container as a unit, select the Engine container to which modules are deployed.
Targets Available Context Group Virtual Host At least one target should be selected.
Deploy New Application Module - Options For Each Component Java Permssion Specification Java Permission Description Options For Each Component
Options for EJB Component Keeping the generated codes Fast Deployment Applying this settings to the same type of modules? URI
WEB Component Options Context Group Application Client Component Options Resource Adapter Component Options
Deploy New Application Module - Common Options
New Application Module - Deployment Deployment 2 Phase Deployment If the 2 Phase Deployment option is selected, deployment will not be completed unless the given modules are successfully deployed to all the targets. Even when one module fails to be deployed, other modules successfully deployed in advance will be automatically removed.
Permanent Deploy Configuration Permanent Deploy If Permanent Deploy is selected, the module information is registered in the JEUSMain.xml file and JEUS is automatically booted. Note that if this value is selected, runtime deployment is not available. You can check permanently deployed modules from the permanent deployment tree.
There are no booted engine containers. If Permanent Deploy is selected, the module information is registered in the JEUSMain.xml file and JEUS is automatically booted. Note that if this value is selected, runtime deployment is not available. You can check permanently deployed modules from the permanent deployment tree.
Runtime Deploy When permanent deploy, select whether runtime deploy or not.

You can enter up to 5000 bytes.
Specify the handler name. This name should be unique within the logger. This name will be used to call the handler in tools.
Set the encoding that will be used when the handler leaves a messages. Specify the fully qualified class name for the filer class that will be set for the handler.
Specify the file name for the handler. If not specified, the default file name of each logger will be used. Refer to the JEUS Server Guide for information on default file names.
The handler can use only use files during the specified period, or when the period has been renewed. Specify the size of the buffer that the handler will use to export to files. If the file that the handler is using already exists, this specifies whether to continue writing on from the end of the file. If this is set to false, the existing file will be deleted.
Specify the fully qualified class name for the user-created hander. This class should inherit java.util.logging.Handler and implement jeus.util.logging.JeusHandler.
Specify the properties to be sent to the handler when it is created. These properties are stored in a map object as key-values and they are sent to the handler using the JeusHandler.setProperty() method.
Specify the fully qualified class name for the formatter that the handler will use. This class should inherit java.util.logging.Formatter and implement jeus.util.logging.JeusFormatter.
Specify the properties to be sent to the formatter that is created when the handler is created. These properties are stored in a map object as key-values and they are sent to the formatter using the JeusFormatter.setProperty() method.
Specify the SMTP server address for sending email. Specify the address of the email sender. Specify the address of the email receiver. Specify the address of the person that will receive a carbon copy (CC) of the email. Specify the address of the person who will receive a blind carbon copy (BCC) of the email. This specifies whether messages received through the log() method of the logger registered by this handler are to be sent as email. If this value is set to false, only the messages specifically called by the send() method of the logger will be sent as email. In other words, only those messages originally designated to be sent as email will be sent as email.
Specify the IP address to which messages will be sent when the handler is created. Specify the port to which messages will be sent when this handler is created. Create the configured handler in runtime and apply settings to the XML file. Handler Configuration - Default handler configuration Change the selected handler settings.
If not selected, explicit adjustments made to the sub-logger's level by users will not be applied.
Use parent handler.

Subject check Custom service Security domain - Encoding algorithm Security domain - Cache service Security domain - Key store service Security domain - Authentication service Security domain - Grat authority service Security domain - Login service Security domain - ID verification service Security domain - Credential mapping service Security domain - Credential verification service Security domain - Subject check service Security domain - Test service Select credential verification service. There are two types: password verification and certificate verification. Specifies whether the subject verficaiton service is to be used. Security domain - User service Users can register a user service for each basic service provided by JEUS. However, user services cannot have configurations redundant to those of the basic services provided by JEUS (all services, excluding cache and key store services). Thus if a user registers a user service, the existing service settings for the relevant basics service will be deleted.
All settings for basic services provided by JEUS will be deleted (authentication, authority, JAAS login, ID verification, credential server). \r\nDo you want to register the user service?

Connection status Command Recover Recover storage Recover remote DB or local embedded DB. No available JMS resource. Broker name
Broker name of failed server. If this option is not set, JEUS_HOME/logs/jeus_mq/broker_name will be used as the storage path of the embedded DB.
Data source
Data source name for remote DB. If the data source is not registered within the JEUSMain.xml file, create the data source using connectionpooladmin.
Storage path Embedded DB path. If the path is not the absolute path, refer to JEUS_HOME/logs/jeus_mq. Recover all Recover all messages excluding pending transaction messages and send them immediately. Destination table Specify the name of the table for destination information. Transaction table Specify the name of the table for transaction information. Subscription table Subscription table name Durable subscriber table Specify the name of the table for durable subscriber information. User properties Specify the name of the table for user properties information. Durable message table Specify the name of the table for durable message information. SQL Poll Timeout Specifies the waiting time for SQLCommandExecutor to receive an SQL command from the SQL queue.
Wait SQL Executor Specifies whether to wait until the jobs in the SQL queue are completed before closing SQLCommandExecutor, which performs database operations in the background.
Message table Specify the name of the table for message information. Delete Invalid Destination Specifies whether to delete the destination completely from storage if the destination, which was recovered from storage when the JMS engine was started, is not specified within the 'JMSMain.xml' file.
Transfer Transfer Transfer the standby broker message to the active broker. Active broker name to be transferred. There is no Active broker name to be transferred. Use version management Save previously deployed modules. Version management Version management Module name Time File name Deploy Modified item Select the file to be deployed. Select the directory when choosing auto-deploy to specify the absolute path.
Application Modules Displays the list of application modules that have been deployed through Standard Deployment, Permanent Deployment and Auto Deployment. It displays the entire list of current application modules and provides easy access to the modules.
Overview
Engine Container Resources Engine Container Resources include JDBC data sources, JMS, JCA resources, WebT, and transactions. JDBC data sources can be added from the JEUS Manager and can only be monitored and managed within the Engine Container. JMS resources can only be used when the JMS Engine is running. JCA resources can be used when the Resource Adapter Module is deployed. Transactions are resources that exist in every Engine Container.
Overview JDBC JEUS data sources are resources used when connecting applications to the database using JDBC. The addition and removal of JDBC data sources can be performed using JEUS administrator. You can use the binding object in JEUS administrator by looking this up from each engine container.
JMS JMS resources include Topic/Queue Connection Factory, Topic/Queue Destination, and Client. (Reference : In order to use JMS resources, the JMS engine should be included in the engine container.)
JCA JCA resources provide connection information by using the monitoring functions for Connections and the Connection Pool. JCA controls the Connection Pool through the Enable, Disable, Shrink, and Resync functions.
WebT WebT data source is a resource that is used when connecting applications to Tmax using WebT. The addition and removal of a WebT data source can be performed using JEUS administrator. You can use the binding object in JEUS administrator by looking this up from each engine container.
Transaction The Transaction Manager(TM) starts and terminates global transactions. Before terminating a transaction, the TM communicates with the Resource Manager (RM) to determine whether the transaction should be committed or rolled back. Thus the TM ensures the atomicity of global transactions. There are various timeout mechanisms to handle a range of exceptional situations. The timeout values for TM are specified for each sub element.
JMS resource JMS resources include Topic/Queue Connection Factory, Topic/Queue Destination, and Client. In order to use JMS resources, the JMS engine should be included in the Engine Container.
Overview Topic/Queue Connection Factory The Connection Factory is used to create and save connections within the JEUS JMS server. It facilitates the convenient use of the client applications.
Topic/Queue Destination Destination is the location where JMS client applications send and receive messages. Client This shows information about JMS client resources, such as name, host address, port, transaction, rollback, commit, and connection.
JEUS manager resource This shows resource information about JDBC, URL, Java mail, WebT, and MQ. JEUS data source is a resource that is used when connecting applications to the database using JDBC. URL sources are used to bind the URL to the JNDI name. Java Mail uses mail protocols such as SMTP to send emails from the client application. WebT data sources can be added using JEUS manager, while the engine container can only be used to monitor and manage them. JEUS can be linked to other MQ products by setting the MQ data sources within JEUS manager service.
Overview JDBC JDBC data sources are defined from the JEUS manager resource. When you first look up a certain JDBC data source from an engine container using JNDI, the JDBC data sources will be displayed in the engine container.
URL URL resources are used to register URLs to JNDI. In this way, client applications can indirectly access URLs.
Java mail Java mail uses mail protocols such as SMTP to send emails from client applications.
WebT WebT is an abbreviation for "Web Transaction". It supports transactions between Tmax (middleware product for the C/S environment) and JEUS (Web Application Server product for the web environment). WebT data sources are resources used to connect applications to Tmax using WebT.
MQ MQ resources are non-standard resources that can connect to JEUS. IBM MQ and SonicMQ are currently available as JEUS MQ resources. IBM MQ (Message Queue) is IBM's Message Queue service, while Sonic MQ was developed by Sonic Software.
JEUS manager service Used to set the configuration of the naming server, distributed session server, centralized session server, JMX, scheduler, security, log, virtual host, JNLP, and log analysis.
Overview Naming server Java Naming and Directory Interface (JNDI) is an API used by java applications to retrieve objects from a network. The only thing that applications need to know in order to retrieve an object is its logical name. This feature provides users with a more convenient method of using objects than was available in previous enterprise environments. JEUS Naming Server consists of the JNSServer and JNSLocal, which have different configurations.
Distributed session server The distributed session server was introduced in JEUS v5.0. It provides greater performance than the previous central session server. It is highly recommended to use this session server.
Central session server The central session server collects and manages all session data from a session. That is, the central session server is used by both the session objects of specific clients and the sessions created by specific servlet engines. There are two key benefits of the central session server. Benefit 1: It is not necessary to use the session routing of the web server. Benefit 2: A backup central session server can be used to back up session data so that system can provide more reliable services. With the backup server, sessions can be maintained more reliably, even handling servlet engine failure.
JMX JEUS JMX Manager contains management objects such as JMX Remote API connector, HTML adaptor, and SNMP adaptor. This is the method for accessing JEUS monitoring information.
Scheduler JEUS Scheduler provides scheduling functions for the jobs that are performed repetitively or that have to be completed at specific times. JEUS Scheduler can be used with user applications or with JEUS servers. JEUS server can access the scheduler service remotely and the jobs to be scheduled can be specified in the configuration file.
Security The security targets are resources that provide services or operate the system, as well as personal information such as user names, passwords, and addresses. To protect important information and system resources, security software and hardware security are used. JEUS provides a variety of security services that protect resources and user information.
Log JEUS notifies users of various situations that occur through logs. In JEUS v1.4 and above, logs are implemented based on the logging API. Thus, the configuration format reflects the logger, handler, and formatter structure of the logging API. Developers can use the logging API to specify JEUS logger.
Virtual host Previous versions (prior to versions JEUS 4.x) only allowed one IP address for each node. and generally only one JEUS server existed within each machine. However by using virtual hosts, multiple JEUS servers can now exist within one machine with a single IP address. Note that this service is different from the virtual host service used by sublet engines. Here, virtual hosts are considered as virtual nodes.
JNLP JNLP, Java Network Launching Protocol (JNLP) is a protocol for deploying and implementing software componenets. JNLP makes applications accessible from the J2EE server. For more information on JNLP, refer to http://java.sun.com/products/javawebstart/. Web admin allows users to configure JNLPMain.xml, the configuration file for JNLP services.
Log Analysis The Log Analysis service provides analysis services used with JEUS' log services. The log services provided by JEUS are: Error Log Filtering Service, Access Log Analysis Service, Log Message StackTrace Service, and Off-Line Log Analysis Service.
JCA Resource The JCA Resource provides connection status information through the monitoring functions of Connection and the Connection Pool. It enables users to access monitoring functions through the Enable, Disable, Shrink, and Resync function.
Overview
JEUS Monitoring Displays thread monitoring and transaction monitoring information. Thread monitoring information includes information about the thread pool, while transaction monitoring includes information about ongoing transactions, incomplete transactions, and retried transactions.
Overview Thread Monitoring Displays information about the thread pool and enables users to modify the values of Pool Max, core, and keep-alive time.
Transaction Monitoring Displays information about incomplete transactions. An 'incomplete' transaction is a transaction that should be rolled back or committed and for which a decision has not yet been made. This transaction information is explained below.
MBean Monitoring Displays information about MBean, its attributes, and values.
Engine Container Service The Engine container contains the scheduler and JMX servers. The scheduler server is used to schedule jobs to be performed at specific times. The JMX server is used in JEUS Manager and in each engine container.
Overview Scheduler JEUS Scheduler provides scheduling functions for the jobs that are performed repetitively or that have to be completed at specific times.
JMX JEUS JMX Manager contains management objects such as JMX Remote API connector, HTML adaptor, and SNMP adaptor. This is the method for accessing JEUS monitoring information.
